de.iftm.dcm4che.router.property
Class PropertyString

java.lang.Object
  de.iftm.dcm4che.router.property.PropertyString

public class PropertyString
extends java.lang.Object

This class analyses property key and value strings with special meanings.

Constructor Detail

PropertyString

public PropertyString(java.lang.String str)
Creates a new PropertyString object.

Parameters:
str - the string to analyse
Method Detail

isLeadIn

protected boolean isLeadIn(char c)
Tests, if the PropertyString starts with a lead in character. A character is lead in characeter, if the PropertyString is not null, its length is graeter than 1 and the first and second character are different.

Parameters:
c - the lead in character to test
Returns:
true, if the PropertyString starts with the given lead in character.

isCommand

public boolean isCommand()
Tests, if the PropertyString starts with the lead in character '#'.

Returns:
true, if the PropertyString starts with the lead in character '#'.

getCommand

public java.lang.String getCommand()
Returns the command given in the PropertyString. A command is a PropertyString that starts with the lead in character '#' without the '#' caharcter.

Returns:
the command or "" if the PropertyString does not start with the lead in character '#'.

getContents

public java.lang.String getContents(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Gets the contents of the PropertyString. If it is a named tag or hexadecimal tag the contents is the contents of the specified tag extracted from the given Dataset. Else it is the String given in the constructor of the PropertyString.

Parameters:
ds - the Dataset the tag should be extracted from (if needed).
Returns:
the contents.

getNamedTag

protected java.lang.String getNamedTag(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Gets the contents of the named Tag specified in the PropertyString from the given Dataset. A named tag starts with the lead in character '$'. The name is the name of the tag specified in the class org.dcm4che.dict.Tags. (Example: $PatientName)

Parameters:
ds - the Dataset the tag should be extracted from.
Returns:
the contens of the tag.

getHexadecimalTag

protected java.lang.String getHexadecimalTag(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Gets the contents of the hexadecimal Tag specified in the PropertyString from the given Dataset. A hexadecimal tag starts with the lead in character '@'. It is followed by the 4 character long hexadecimal representation of the group end the element number (Example: @00080020 for the StudyDate).

Parameters:
ds - the Dataset the tag should be extracted from.
Returns:
the contens of the tag.
